title: Banned
body:
The banning process should not only take into account previous behaviour but the reasoning for that behaviour, for example with my account i just had perm banned, after 1 game after being unbanned. In that game I had a kogmaw adc who raged at our support then left lane to purposely ruining mid (my lane) for no other reason to spite karma, i politely asked him to leave lane but he refused, after several times asking him, he got toxic with me and so did the jungler, i then got frustrated after only getting one game back on the account and i get trolls that purposely ruin the game and then be abusive to the people they ruin it for. I know i was toxic but they were the ones that made me into that mindset due to them purposely ruining the game. So i ask to have the footage of the game reviewed not just the chat but the whole game along side the chat to see why I became toxic towards the members of my team ruining the game and abusing me in the first place. 

I am sure many other players experience this as well, where other people troll and intentional ruin the game, so we get pissed off and swear at them to go away after 15min of them not listening, only for us to be the ones banned for their behaviour of purposely ruining the game. It has happened to me on several occasions where people troll, i tell them to stop and im the one reported for it. Fix tribunal to look at the games not the chat, actions speak louder than words remember riot.

Can confirm this, I purposefully tried to ban myself by not saying anything in chat and completely ruining the game for half a year, guess whether that account is banned or not.

Please bear in mind that by responding to people being toxic, you are increasing the toxicity of the game for other people. This is why the system does not necessarily discriminate between the person who started it and the person responding. 

Sometimes teammates can be so upset and unwilling to communicate that the best course of action is to mute them, so that you are no longer tempted to respond.
